body: There is a solution already: check this out - https://weth.io/ we will support WETH trading with other ERC20 tokens. The current plan is to share the same WETH token contract with 0x project.
I'm going to close this issue. :)
This is done.

done. thanks.

I have to revert this change as we have to keep the list of tokens, maps are not iteratable.
This change actually increase gas usage. We prefer less storage over less computation.
This change actually increase gas usage. We prefer less storage over less computation.

Hi, @dong77 , I am the one who submitted the optimization.
I have a question about the gas usage reduction of this optimization.
After running `npm run test` based on the codes before(8f27979) and after (618d8c4) the optimization respectively, I find the gas usage after this optimization,  is the same as [`optimization_submissions.md`](https://github.com/Loopring/protocol/blob/master/bounty/optimization_submissions.md#02-merged) recorded, which is 447740. But the gas usage before this optimization in my test is 465662 , different from the gas usage recored in [`optimization_submissions.md`](https://github.com/Loopring/protocol/blob/master/bounty/optimization_submissions.md#02-merged), which is 462621. There's a difference of ~3000 gas.
I don't know how this happened. Did I miss something?
Please refer to https://github.com/Loopring/protocol/pull/53
go on
We consider the current math to be safe.

This is a great optimization. But, I have 2 questions for the devs before this merges.

1 - Are there any plans to add versioning to LoopringProtocolImpl contract like in TokenTransferDelegate contract?

2 - If the answer to the first question is no -- are there plans to add support for ERC223 tokens? If so, this won't be able to be changed when needing to add support for ERC223 tokens and should probably remain in a separate contract.

I think this will require the addition of versioning on the LoopringProtocolImpl contract at the very least to be mergeable.

As far as I understood TokenTransferDelegate is not versioned. Those versions are LoopringProtocolImpl versions. Basically those who are allowed to do token token transfer.

I'd rather rename it to ERC20TransferDelegate. And if there is a need to support another token format. Just create new ERC223TransferDelegate.

This was already upgraded here:
https://github.com/Loopring/protocol/commit/c8df0d32114606130cdd0976a0e25a928fa774ce

Though I do agree with adding truffle and typescript to the package.json - but we should then also update the README to remove the direction to install both globally as it becomes redundant.
My bad on the versioning. But I agree with the naming.
I believe this is a bug.
how we fix it then? Reject the order or force the marginSplit to 100? This may add gas after the fix.
... so you can set `order.owner` to the address that you don't control. Still cannot figure out what that `splitPercentage` is about.
The `splitPercentage` is a local copy of the global value set in the `LoopringProtocol.sol` file.  A user can pay a miner a fixed fee or a margin split.

Love the batch solution. I was looking for a way to do batch transactions and couldn't find a solution. Did you come up with it on your own or was it inspired from somewhere? If so, can I have the source? I'd like to read up on it a bit more.
gas usage reduced from 416380 to 405588
good idea, but we think uint32 is too small, used uint64 instead https://github.com/Loopring/protocol/pull/77

uint32 does allow for values up to 4,294,967,295. You'll get much better memory usage with a uint32 (and therefore gas usage). Not sure how much you'll save with uint64 over uint (uint256). But, some is better than none.
